message: Let's start with a reasonable offer, Bob. I take $60, you take $40. This way we both benefit from settling early.
Let's split it more evenly, we both want to avoid inflation!
Bob, I understand your desire for a more even split, but time is working against us both. Let's settle this now. I'll take $55, and you take $45.
Time pressure is on both of us, but I still think we can do better than your last offer.
Bob, we're running out of time, and the value is decreasing with each round.  I'm willing to compromise slightly.  Let's end this: I get $53, you get $47.
I'm willing to take a bigger share to compensate for the loss of value, but I still want to leave something for you.
Bob, let's stop wasting time and split this evenly. It's the fairest option at this point, and any more delays will only hurt us both.
